title: How to Make Cheese Enchiladas

steps.headline: Pre-heat the oven to 350 degrees F, 117 degrees C, or on gas mark 4.
Get a bowl and add the garlic, oregano, flour, chili powder, cocoa powder, salt, and tomato paste to the bowl.
steps.description: Use less chili powder for a milder sauce.

steps.headline: Stir the sauce together to create a smooth paste.
steps.description: If the mixture is too thick, add a little water and continue to stir. Transfer the sauce into a saucepan and cook over a medium heat. Pour in the rest of the water and stir constantly. Remove from the heat once the sauce is thick.

steps.headline: Heat an oiled skillet over medium heat.
steps.description: Also, heat a frying pan or griddle over medium heat.

steps.headline: Fry the tortillas in the frying pan for 1 minute on each side.
steps.description: Place the tortilla into the oiled skillet just long enough to coat the entire tortilla. Place the oiled and finished tortilla on a plate and repeat this for the rest of the tortillas.

steps.headline: Add a handful of cheese and onions to each tortilla.
steps.description: Roll the tortilla into cylinders and place them into a pan for cooking.

steps.headline: Cover the enchiladas with the sauce.
steps.description: Sprinkle additional cheese on the top of the sauce.

steps.headline: Place the pan in the oven for 5 minutes or until the cheese has melted.
Serve the enchiladas by using a spatula to take them out of the pan and plating them.
steps.description: Garnish with green onions for extra flavor.

text: Pre-heat the oven to 350 degrees F, 117 degrees C, or on gas mark 4.  Get a bowl and add the garlic, oregano, flour, chili powder, cocoa powder, salt, and tomato paste to the bowl. Use less chili powder for a milder sauce. Stir the sauce together to create a smooth paste. If the mixture is too thick, add a little water and continue to stir. Transfer the sauce into a saucepan and cook over a medium heat. Pour in the rest of the water and stir constantly. Remove from the heat once the sauce is thick. Heat an oiled skillet over medium heat. Also, heat a frying pan or griddle over medium heat. Fry the tortillas in the frying pan for 1 minute on each side. Place the tortilla into the oiled skillet just long enough to coat the entire tortilla. Place the oiled and finished tortilla on a plate and repeat this for the rest of the tortillas. Add a handful of cheese and onions to each tortilla. Roll the tortilla into cylinders and place them into a pan for cooking. Cover the enchiladas with the sauce. Sprinkle additional cheese on the top of the sauce. Place the pan in the oven for 5 minutes or until the cheese has melted.  Serve the enchiladas by using a spatula to take them out of the pan and plating them. Garnish with green onions for extra flavor.
